message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Values Survey and the European Social Survey, we examine the relationship between social capital and perceived well-being in Europe.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Social Survey"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on administrative data provided by the Ministry of Finance and Economic Development in Rwanda to investigate the impact of budget support on local government performance.", "dataset": ["administrative data provided by the Ministry of Finance and Economic Development in Rwanda"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We use a dataset that links firms' taxes with their customs activities to identify the effect of exporting on tax behavior for a large panel of Belarusian firms over the period 2010-2015.", "dataset": ["dataset that links firms' taxes with their customs activities"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) and the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS), we explore geographic disparities in diabetes prevalence and risk factors in the United States.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES)", "Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Demographic and Health Surveys done in several sub-Saharan African countries to estimate the effect of women's autonomy on maternal health and child nutrition outcomes.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Gender", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses panel data on household consumption and income from the Mexican Family Life Survey to investigate the effect of conditional cash transfers on children's education attainment and labor market outcomes.", "dataset": ["Mexican Family Life Survey"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Combining data on the distribution of power plants from the Global Power Plant Database with remote sensing data from the MODIS satellite, we explore the impact of air pollution from coal-fired power plants on local crop yields in India.", "dataset": ["Global Power Plant Database", "MODIS satellite"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Energy", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset that links GPS location data with mobile phone records from Cote d'Ivoire, we investigate the relationship between urbanization and crime using spatial econometric modeling techniques.", "dataset": ["dataset that links GPS location data with mobile phone records from Cote d'Ivoire"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "We leverage a unique combination of micro data from household surveys and macroeconomic data from national accounts to estimate the effects of agricultural productivity shocks on intergenerational mobility in Tanzania.", "dataset": ["micro data from household surveys", "macroeconomic data from national accounts"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the Doing Business Indicators, we assess the role of business regulations and corruption on firm performance in Eastern Europe and Central Asia.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Doing Business Indicators"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Governance"]}]
